topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Alpha: Troubleshooting

body.p: This topic describes all the known issues that you might encounter.

section.title: VM fails to get private/Fixed IP address
section.p: After configuring the VRS-G during installation, the VRS-G VM is assigned with private and floating IP, when seen on the VSD dashboard. However, if you launch a console session to the VM, there is no networking.
Make sure the Glance image has the correct properties set. For example, check that the adapter type is ide. Also, check if gateway and subnet values are correctly assigned to VRSvAPPs.

section.title: VRSvAPPs missing in VSD dashboard
section.p: While performing basic verification of cloud deployment, the VRSvAPPs might not appear in the VSD dashboard and the associated TUL addresses are not pingable from VRS-G node.
Above changes required vswitch1 on VRSvAPPs to be presented on Niantics as well. Once this was done, VRSvAPPS were synchronized in VSD dashboard.
Memphis region deployment is done with following networking changes.

UNTAGGED TUL on NIANTICS on DCN, VRS and WR Computes

section.title: Backup storage size should be at least 120GB
section.p: If you experience the following error, you can edit the region_config file for the KVM region to increase the default storage.

ol.li: Log into the KVM region controller-0.
Edit the ./<cloud name>/clouds/<cloud name>/001/stage/windriver-config/region_config file to update the backup_storage value to 120 or higher.
